newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek closed-end funds at 5.0pct discount in April.
newsitem.headline: Greek closed-end funds at 5.0pct discount in April.

text.p: Greece's 16 closed-end investment funds listed on the Athens bourse had a market capitalisation of 142.7 billion drachmas at the end of April, the Association of Institutional Investors said in its recently launched monthly review.
Closed-end funds traded at an average discount of five percent to market capitalisation at the end of April.
Statistics showed that 11 out of 16 funds were trading at a discount to their net asset value (NAV) at the end of April.
Total NAV amounted to 150.3 billion drachmas on April 30 compared to 143.9 billion at the end of March.

Listed Greek closed-end funds raised their equity allocation, shifting funds previously invested in fixed-income securities and money-market instruments in the same month. ASSET CLASS April 30, 1997 March 31, 1997 Equity 75.2 70.8 - Greek 66.3

Only three funds -- Ergo, National and Piraeus -- managed to outperform the market's 53.74 percent climb in the first four months of 1997. One fund -- Aspis -- was priced lower in April than in the beginning of the year.
